body_html:
The failures on pytorch-linux-trusty-py3.6-gcc7.2 are interesting as they appear isolated to that system but are in the JIT. In particular, the JIT is complaining that it cannot compile some CPU kernels (and suggesting some assembly arguments are wrong!).

The same tests run correctly on pytorch-linux-trusty-py3.6-gcc5.4, suggesting this issue is related to the gcc version.

I did not expect these tests or CPU kernels to be affected by these changes. I will look at setting up an environment to review them more carefully but if someone knows a particular gcc7.2 gotcha I missed please let me know.

The same tests run correctly on pytorch-linux-trusty-py3.6-gcc5.4, suggesting this issue is related to the gcc version.
I did not expect these tests or CPU kernels to be affected by these changes. I will look at setting up an environment to review them more carefully but if someone knows a particular gcc7.2 gotcha I missed please let me know.
body:
The failures on pytorch-linux-trusty-py3.6-gcc7.2 are interesting as they appear isolated to that system but are in the JIT. In particular, the JIT is complaining that it cannot compile some CPU kernels (and suggesting some assembly arguments are wrong!). 

The same tests run correctly on pytorch-linux-trusty-py3.6-gcc5.4, suggesting this issue is related to the gcc version. 

I did not expect these tests or CPU kernels to be affected by these changes. I will look at setting up an environment to review them more carefully but if someone knows a particular gcc7.2 gotcha I missed please let me know.
